messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of Conditional Use for Retail Sale of Packaged Alcoholic Beverages
- Summary: The ordinance sought to permit the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in a specific district. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33297 - 28673 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in the designated district.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Alcoholic Beverages, Retail Sale, Zoning
- UID: 8c2d877c-2a37-4ede-b232-ffc77dc832fe

- Topic: Establishment of Conditional Use for Hotel with Live Entertainment
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to permit a hotel with live entertainment as a secondary use in specific districts. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33298 - 28674 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the establishment of a hotel with live entertainment in the designated districts.
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Hotel, Live Entertainment, Zoning
- UID: 8c2d877c-2a37-4ede-b232-ffc77dc832fe

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Child Care Funding
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to transfer funds to the Mayor’s Office of Youth & Families to fund child care for low-income families. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33299 - 28675 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, providing funding for child care for low-income families.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating Budget, Child Care Funding, Low-Income Families
- UID: 8c2d877c-2a37-4ede-b232-ffc77dc832fe
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Establishment of Algiers Riverfront Overlay District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish the Algiers Riverfront Overlay District to ensure that certain uses and designs are compatible with and preserve the character and integrity of Algiers. It also includes rezoning areas from MU-1 to HU-MU zoning, excluding Square 9. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,300
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Algiers Riverfront, Rezoning
- UID: 2b630232-2c9b-471f-a3d3-f84a3e2a6e50

- Topic: Amendment for Fast Food Restaurant with Drive-thru Facilities
- Summary: This ordinance grants an amendment to permit a fast food restaurant with drive-thru facilities in specific commercial and overlay districts. It pertains to Square H-D, Lot 1, in the Fifth Municipal District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,301
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Fast Food Restaurant, Drive-thru Facilities
- UID: 2b630232-2c9b-471f-a3d3-f84a3e2a6e50

- Topic: Appropriation of State Grant Funds for City Operating Budget
- Summary: This ordinance amends the city's operating budget for 2021 to appropriate state grant funds awarded by the Louisiana Commission on Law Enforcement. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,307
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating Budget, State Grant Funds
- UID: 2b630232-2c9b-471f-a3d3-f84a3e2a6e50
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Appropriation of state grant funds for protective supplies for NOPD Crime Lab personnel
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to amend the operating budget to appropriate state grant funds for the purchase of protective supplies for NOPD Crime Lab personnel, specifically to protect them while working on crime scenes and in COVID-19 pandemic environments. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33307 - 28679 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted to allocate state grant funds for protective supplies for NOPD Crime Lab personnel.
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, protective supplies, NOPD Crime Lab, operating budget
- UID: 2f96ce5b-2ac6-4fbf-ad13-d74037076713

- Topic: Allocation of state grant funds for officer overtime for specific police activities
- Summary: This ordinance sought to amend the operating budget of revenues to allocate state grant funds for officer overtime to assist police in conducting increased sex offender compliance checks and tracking the number of domestic violence follow-up investigations. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33308 - 28680 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted to allocate state grant funds for officer overtime for specific police activities.
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, officer overtime, police activities, sex offender compliance checks, domestic violence investigations
- UID: 2f96ce5b-2ac6-4fbf-ad13-d74037076713

- Topic: Amendment of operating budget of revenues for NOPD activities
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to amend the operating budget of revenues to appropriate state grant funds for specific NOPD activities related to sex offender compliance checks and domestic violence investigations. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33309 - 28681 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted to amend the operating budget of revenues for specific NOPD activities.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating budget, state grant funds, NOPD activities, sex offender compliance checks, domestic violence investigations
- UID: 2f96ce5b-2ac6-4fbf-ad13-d74037076713
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for State Grant Funds
- Summary: This ordinance sought to appropriate state grant funds awarded by the Louisiana Commission on Law Enforcement to the New Orleans Police Department for officer overtime to assist with increased sex offender compliance checks and domestic violence follow-up investigations. The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Budget Committee and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33310 - 28682 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Appropriation of state grant funds for specific policing activities
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, police department, officer overtime, domestic violence, compliance checks
- UID: 2e02a0f7-9948-4dc8-93d5-be52f08dd926

- Topic: Appropriation of FY 2018 Family Recovery Collaborative Grant Funds
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to appropriate the balance of FY 2018 Family Recovery Collaborative grant funds from the Department of Justice to the Department of Health for assisting mothers in the New Orleans area with opioid addiction. The ordinance received approval from the Budget Committee and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33311 - 28683 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Allocation of grant funds for opioid addiction support
- Tags/Keywords: Grant funds, opioid addiction, Department of Health, Department of Justice
- UID: 2e02a0f7-9948-4dc8-93d5-be52f08dd926

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Federal Grant Funds
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to appropriate the balance of FY 2018 Family Recovery Collaborative grant funds awarded by the Federal Department of Justice to the New Orleans Department of Health for assisting mothers in the New Orleans area with opioid addiction. The ordinance was subject to a postponement deadline and was recommended for approval by the Budget Committee. It was ultimately adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33312
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Allocation of federal grant funds for opioid addiction support
- Tags/Keywords: Federal grant funds, opioid addiction, Department of Health, Department of Justice
- UID: 2e02a0f7-9948-4dc8-93d5-be52f08dd926
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Appropriation of American Rescue Act grant funds for COVID-19 vaccine activities
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate grant funds for the New Orleans Department of Health to promote, distribute, administer, and track COVID-19 vaccines. The funds will be used for planning, preparing, and executing vaccine-related activities to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33312 - 28684 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of the ordinance
- Tags/Keywords: American Rescue Act, grant funds, COVID-19 vaccines
- UID: a14dc6e3-cfd5-4f94-baf7-6be8b34de218

- Topic: Appropriation of American Rescue Act grant funds for COVID-19 vaccine activities
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to appropriate grant funds for the New Orleans Department of Health to administer and track COVID-19 vaccines. The funds will support planning, preparing, and executing vaccine-related activities to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33313 - 28685 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of the ordinance
- Tags/Keywords: American Rescue Act, grant funds, COVID-19 vaccines
- UID: a14dc6e3-cfd5-4f94-baf7-6be8b34de218

- Topic: Appropriation of state grant funds for public safety personnel training and equipment
- Summary: This ordinance aims to appropriate state grant funds to the Office of Homeland Security for training and equipment for public safety personnel. The funds are from the FY2020 State Homeland Security Program. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33314 - 28686 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of the ordinance
- Tags/Keywords: state grant funds, public safety, Homeland Security Program
- UID: a14dc6e3-cfd5-4f94-baf7-6be8b34de218

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Building Code for Construction Projects
- Summary: The ordinance aims to require video or photographic inspections of public infrastructure near construction sites before issuing building permits or Certificates of Occupancy. It also assigns responsibility for repairing any damage found during inspections.
- Ordinance Number: 33,302
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any opposition.
- Tags/Keywords: Building Code, Construction Projects, Infrastructure Inspection
- UID: b0684638-5ff6-48f4-ba05-4cb1ba879d3c

- Topic: Amendment to City's Towing Allocation List
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to remove the use of tow zones in the City's tow allocation program and establish revised procedures, fees, penalties, and other requirements for the program.
- Ordinance Number: 33,303
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with one opposing vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Towing Allocation, Tow Zones, Fees, Penalties
- UID: b0684638-5ff6-48f4-ba05-4cb1ba879d3c

- Topic: Regulation of Pedal Carriages
- Summary: This ordinance aims to define "pedal carriages" and forbid their operation or the offering of transportation for hire within the City of New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: 33,304
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Referred to the Transportation Committee)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was referred to the Transportation Committee for further consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Pedal Carriages, Transportation Regulation, City Ordinance
- UID: b0684638-5ff6-48f4-ba05-4cb1ba879d3c
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Pedal Carriage Ban
- Summary: The amendment proposed adding a new section to reconsider the ban on pedal carriages, subject to appropriate regulations. The amendment passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33304-28678 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to reconsider the ban on pedal carriages was approved.
- Tags/Keywords: Pedal Carriage Ban, Amendment, Regulations
- UID: 68944eb6-f92e-4d56-ba8a-a9dcc638ca6d

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Municipal Yacht Harbor
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Municipal Yacht Harbor Management Corporation for the repair and reconstruction of the Municipal Yacht Harbor. The details of the agreement were attached to the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33304-28678 AS AMENDED
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was presented, but no voting outcome was provided.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Yacht Harbor, Reconstruction
- UID: 68944eb6-f92e-4d56-ba8a-a9dcc638ca6d

- Topic: Pardon for Violation of Municipal Marijuana Possession

- Topic: French Market Overlay District Text Amendment
- Summary: The ordinance requests a text amendment to establish the French Market Overlay District, which recognizes the unique configuration of the French Market District and includes expanded hours of operation in the Public Market and unified pedestrian scaled signage. The City Planning Commission recommended "FOR MODIFIED APPROVAL".
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 23/21
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The requested text amendment was approved, with the additional language prohibiting live entertainment indoors or outdoors after 8:00 p.m. added as a modification by the Commission.

- UID: bac34028-eb7d-48fc-8e1b-e4fc76c38d6b

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of City Code regarding Mayor and City Council's pardon power and marijuana possession
- Summary: The ordinance aims to clarify the pardon power of the Mayor and City Council, specifically regarding the prospective pardon of marijuana possession. It was introduced by Councilmember Moreno and laid over as required by law.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,328
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed.
- UID: 4fe6475a-5006-4784-aa1f-5703c8068d5d

- Topic: Enforcement of Smoke Free Air Act and prohibition of smoking marijuana outside of a private residence
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to authorize NOPD to enforce the Smoke Free Air Act only via summons and to prohibit the smoking of marijuana outside of a private residence. It was also introduced by Councilmember Moreno and laid over as required by law.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,329
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules to introduce the ordinance on first reading passed.
- UID: 4fe6475a-5006-4784-aa1f-5703c8068d5d

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Marijuana Regulations
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend certain sections of the City of New Orleans Code related to marijuana, excluding marijuana testing from certain drug testing programs, excluding marijuana accessories from the definition of drug paraphernalia, and clarifying that policy officers have discretion not to issue summons for marijuana possession in certain circumstances. 
- Ordinance Number: 33329
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Marijuana regulations, City of New Orleans Code, drug testing, policy officers

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 5-20-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Granting of Servitude Agreement for Tchoupitoulas Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude consisting of air and ground rights not needed for public purposes to an adjacent property owner for encroachments on/over portions of the public right-of-way adjacent to 3969 Tchoupitoulas Street. The ordinance was submitted by Councilmember Banks and was electronically submitted for postponement on 9/17/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33339
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude Agreement, Tchoupitoulas Street, Councilmember Banks
- UID: c8fa0807-74b0-4e19-8e4c-60faa5dedd3e

- Topic: Lease with New Cingular Wireless PCS, LLC for Rooftop Space
- Summary: This ordinance authorized the Mayor to execute a lease with New Cingular Wireless PCS, LLC for a portion of the rooftop space located at 1601 Perdido Street for a period of five years, with optional renewal terms. The yearly rental was set at $30,000.00 with a fifteen percent increase for each renewal term. 
- Ordinance Number: 33340
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease, New Cingular Wireless, Perdido Street
- UID: c8fa0807-74b0-4e19-8e4c-60faa5dedd3e

- Topic: Lease with United States Postal Service for Property on Liberty Street
- Summary: This ordinance authorized the Mayor to execute a lease with the United States Postal Service for property consisting of portions of South Liberty Street and Julia Street in the First Municipal District of New Orleans. The lease was for a period from October 1, 2020, to September 30, 2025, with a yearly rental of $259,022.00 and a flat increase to a total rent of $293,060.00 per year for one five-year option term.
- Ordinance Number: 33341
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease, United States Postal Service, Liberty Street
- UID: c8fa0807-74b0-4e19-8e4c-60faa5dedd3e
